claim_or_strategy: Narrative-first identity strategy will outperform competing in standardized specialty authority for a small roaster over 90 days.

falsifiers.test_statement: Narrative-first content does not improve retention or repeat purchase behavior.
falsifiers.how_to_test: Run 6-week content cadence + track repeat rate cohort vs prior baseline.
falsifiers.pass_condition: Repeat rate increases >= 10% vs baseline within 6-8 weeks.
falsifiers.fail_condition: Repeat rate is flat or decreases over 8 weeks despite consistent cadence.

falsifiers.test_statement: Customers primarily choose based on price and convenience, making identity irrelevant in this location.
falsifiers.how_to_test: Survey + observe: correlate purchase decisions with promos vs story-led launches.
falsifiers.pass_condition: Story-led launches maintain sales without discounts and increase high-margin items.
falsifiers.fail_condition: Only discounts drive sales; story-led launches underperform consistently.

falsifiers.test_statement: Operational capacity cannot sustain narrative strategy without harming quality or speed.
falsifiers.how_to_test: Measure service time and QC errors during content cadence weeks.
falsifiers.pass_condition: Service time and complaints remain within acceptable bounds.
falsifiers.fail_condition: Service time or complaints exceed bounds for 3+ weeks.

boundary_conditions: Foot traffic is near zero and cannot be influenced by content (structural location issue).
No minimal tracking exists (cannot measure outcomes).
Team capacity is already at burnout threshold.
stop_triggers: Complaints spike > 2x baseline for 2 consecutive weeks
Operational errors become repetitive and unresolved
confidence_impact: Confidence is conditional. If F1 or F2 fails, pivot toward pricing/offer optimization or distribution channels. If F3 triggers, reduce cadence and simplify operations first.
